net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Interface Pageable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, Iterable<Component>, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MTable, MTree, RichList, Table, Tree

    public interface Pageable
extends Component
    This interface should be implemented by components that support paging, ie the ability to view a component a page at a time. This is different than scrolling since scrolling may view any part of a component fairly quickly. Paging is designed for efficient use with slower components so that only a portion of the data will be handled at a time.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getPageCount

        int getPageCount()
        Return the number of pages. If -1 is returned, the page count cannot be efficiently determined.
        Returns:
        The number of pages or -1 if the number of pages cannot be determined.

      • getPageNo

        int getPageNo()
        Get the current page number, page numbers start at 0.
        Returns:
        The page number, zero based.

      • hasPage

        boolean hasPage(int pageNo)
        Determines if the page is valid. This is normally used when getPageCount() returns -1 to signify the page count cannot be efficiently determined.
        Parameters:
        pageNo - The page number, zero based.
        Returns:
        true if the page is valid.

      • isPaging

        boolean isPaging()
        Determine if the Pageable object is currently in paging mode.
        Returns:
        true if in paging mode.

      • setPageNo

        void setPageNo(int pageNo)
        Set the current page number, page numbers start at 0.
        Parameters:
        pageNo - The page number, zero based.

      • startPaging

        void startPaging()
        Start using paging, meaning to display only the current page.

      • stopPaging

        void stopPaging()
        Stop using paging, meaning display the entire content.
